channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade SE19 between Fou, 9th November
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade SE19 between Fountain Drive and Sydenham Hill junction is a long central highway island / carriageway divide. At he Sydenham Hill / streetlight ID number 19 end of this is a Keep Left island board which has been graffiti tagged – check back. (If by any chance this comes under eg Bromley Council please tell me.) Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.426194,-0.0739298,3a,60y,244.73h,80.72t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sJ6y1oVbRaPXMtgE3-LSC4A!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D9.282852455635322%26panoid%3DJ6y1oVbRaPXMtgE3-LSC4A%26yaw%3D244.7281357327077!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTEwNC4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking a narrow street, 9th November
item.description:
Blocking a narrow street LN25 NUE She parks here everyday. Very aggressive when we politely asked not to. We feel threatened (using racism language as well) and believe this should not be allowed. I would really appreciate if some actions will be taken.

item.title: Peabody, mowing of grass, 9th November
item.description:
I live on Whernside Close, nearest to Crossway Park. We have a green area infront of our houses. Peabody mows the grass every so often. On 4th November, the grass was mowed, but the young chap left a mess on the pavements. See picture below. I thought he was going to come back and sweep it up, or Peabody's sweeper, who normally comes after the grass has been mowed. As no one returned from Peabody, my neighbours from the otherside of the green decided to clear the pavement on their side, but was not able to do ours, as it got dark. Do Peabody seriously thinks it is acceptable for residents to clear up after them?? Surely if your job is to maintain the green, then you should clear up after. I would appreciate it if someone can please put this right?? Thanks MS S HOOPER. NOTE, I DID REPORT THIS THE NEXT DAY, BUT WAS TOLD I SENT IT TO THE WRONG DEPARTMENT

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whernside Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurring issue of fly tipping at this spot, 9th November
item.description:
Whether the hair business using these bins don’t have enough bins or can’t be bothered to put the bags inside it. We have regular issues of bags being left on the road and then ripped open by animals and all the litter flying everywhere, it’s disgusting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large gap between paving slabs, poses severe risk to public especially children, 9th November
item.description:
The gap between the Slabs was reported last week, this is directly outside of No21. A contractor came around and moved the slab back into place. This has obviously moved back to its original position and again posing a health and safety issue. This needs to be resolved properly using concrete to ensure it doesn’t move.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
